DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesize that leg edema will decrease rapidly when using the NormaTec pump, patients will lose weight, will feel better, will be less prone to infections in their legs and to congestion of the liver. Temporary elevation of intravascular fluid volume by the mobilized edema fluid returned to the intravascular space by pumping may increase cardiac output and renal perfusion and in addition it may distend the right atrium and ventricle thus inducing BNP secretion. Both mechanisms may promote excess fluid removal by the kidneys.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Normatec Pump for Relief of Leg Edema
DOC.criteria: hemodynamically stable adult patients with pronounced leg edema from any etiology, on optimal medical therapy (such as diuretics, ACEI or ARBs, digoxin). documentation of right heart failure by Echo or other modality (CT, MRI, right heart catheterization) and hemodynamic data from Echo is required and an elevated pulmonary artery pressure (> 35 mmHg) is expected in such cases. patients in sepsis, hemodynamically unstable, during an acute attack of pulmonary edema, with renal failure (creatinine > 2 mg%), with DVT, psychiatric or noncompliant patients, and patients who will not sign the informed consent form will be excluded from the study.
